Alchemical Experimenters A chemical scent overpowers the rot, and precise surgical cuts can be seen on the arms (a PC who succeeds at a @Check[crafting|dc:10|name:Recognize Cuts] or @Check[medicine|dc:10|name:Recognize Cuts] check realizes both are medical but unnecessary)
Slavers The hands still wear heavy manacles around the wrists
Crime Lords The hands are tattooed and some are cleanly missing fingers (a PC who succeeds at a @Check[society|dc:10|name:Recognize Marks] or @Check[underworld-lore|dc:10|name:Recognize Marks]{Underworld Lore} check recognizes these as marks of gangs active before the earthquake)
Misguided Pharasmins A scent of incense lingers as the haunt vanishes (a PC who succeeds at a @Check[religion|dc:10|name:Recognize Rites] or @Check[pharasma-lore|dc:10|name:Recognize Rites]{Pharasma Lore} check recognizes the scent from Pharasmin funerals)

action->Shark Commune 150 feet.name: Shark Commune 150 feet
action->Shark Commune 150 feet.description: The sea devil can communicate telepathically with sharks within range. It can communicate only simple concepts like "come," "guard," or "attack."

action->Aquatic Throwing.name: Aquatic Throwing
action->Aquatic Throwing.description: A sea devil invader's thrown weapons don't have their range increments halved when attacking from underwater or targeting an underwater creature.

action->Blood Frenzy.name: Blood Frenzy
action->Blood Frenzy.description:
Requirements The sea devil is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or already in a frenzy

Trigger The sea devil deals bleed damage to a living creature.

Effect The sea devil flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the sea devil gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls with its claws and jaws, gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with its claws and jaws, gains 11 temporary HP until the end of the frenzy, and takes a -2 status penalty to AC. The sea devil can't voluntarily stop its frenzy. After its frenzy, the sea devil is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

action->Bloodletting.name: Bloodletting
action->Bloodletting.description: When the sea devil deals piercing or slashing damage, it also deals @Damage[1d4[bleed]] if the target was @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} or if the attack was a critical hit.

Season's Toll (3-4).name: Season's Toll (3-4)
Season's Toll (3-4).descriptionHazard: Arcs of primal energy emerge from the L-shaped stone wall at the center of each alcove.
Season's Toll (3-4).disable:
1 @Check[crafting|dc:25] or @Check[thievery|dc:25] (expert) to rig up a dummy or other object to distract one of the trap's sensors, or

1 @Check[nature|dc:23] (trained) to temporarily befuddle one of the sensors with knowledge of primal magic.

Alternatively, inserting the correct key into an alcove's keyhole disables that alcove's sensor.
Season's Toll (3-4).reset: The trap is powered by the Eternal Bloom. It resets after 5 minutes, at which time the doors to the vault slam shut once again.
Season's Toll (3-4).routine:
(4 actions) The trap loses one action per magical sensor disabled. On its initiative, the trap uses each of its actions to target one creature adjacent to or within an alcove with a negative effect that corresponds to the season opposite the one depicted on the alcove's murals (@Check[fortitude|dc:24] to resist). For the purposes of this trap, creatures who are within an alcove's landscape count are within that alcove. The trap can target only one creature per alcove per round.

Spring Alcove (death) The decay of late autumn takes hold of the target.

  • Critical Success The trap has no effect.
  • Success The target takes @Damage[2d6[void]] damage.
  • Failure The target takes @Damage[4d6[void]] damage.
  • Critical Failure The target takes @Damage[4d6[void]] damage and @Damage[1d6[persistent,void]] damage. Effects that use vitality energy, such as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} spell, automatically end this persistent damage.

Summer Alcove (cold) Winter's bitter chill descends on the target.

  • Critical Success The trap has no effect.
  • Success The target takes @Damage[2d6[cold]] damage.
  • Failure The target takes @Damage[4d6[cold]] damage.
  • Critical Failure The target takes @Damage[4d6[cold]] damage;and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 hour.

Autumn Alcove (poison) Poisonous springtime pollen sprays at the target.

  • Critical Success The trap has no effect.
  • Success The target takes @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage.
  • Failure The target takes @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage.
  • Critical Failure The target takes @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Winter Alcove (fire) Heat greater than the hottest summer afternoon engulfs the target.

  • Critical Success The trap has no effect.
  • Success The target takes @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage.
  • Failure The target takes @Damage[4d6[fire]] damage.
  • Critical Failure The target takes @Damage[4d6[fire]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 hour.

action->Season's Toll.name: Season's Toll
action->Season's Toll.description:
Trigger A creature enters one of the four alcoves

Effect The trap rolls initiative.

  • Failure The target takes @Damage[(4d6+4)[void]] damage.
  • Critical Failure The target takes @Damage[(4d6+4)[void]] damage and @Damage[1d6[persistent,void]] damage. Effects that use vitality energy, such as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} spell, automatically end this persistent damage.

  • Failure The target takes @Damage[(4d6+4)[cold]] damage.

  • Critical Success The trap has no effect.
  • Success The target takes @Damage[(2d6+2)[poison]] damage.
  • Failure The target takes @Damage[(4d6+4)[poison]] damage.
  • Critical Failure The target takes @Damage[(4d6+4)[poison]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Winter Alcove (fire) Heat greater than the hottest summer afternoon engulfs the target.

  • Critical Success The trap has no effect.

  • Critical Failure The target takes @Damage[(4d6+4)[fire]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 hour.

action->Season's Toll.name: Season's Toll
action->Season's Toll.description:
Trigger A creature enters one of the four alcoves

Effect The trap rolls initiative.

action->Light Weakness.name: Light Weakness
action->Light Weakness.description: An object shedding magical light (such as from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{Light} spell) deals additional damage to the shadow wisp.

action->Shroud.name: Shroud
action->Shroud.description:
Requirements The shadow wisp's previous action was a hit against an adjacent creature with its shadow tendril Strike.

Effect The shadow wisp @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{Steps} into the creature's space and attempts an @Check[acrobatics|defense:reflex] check against the target's Reflex DC to attach itself to the target's shadow.

As long as it remains attached, it moves with the target and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to attacks from the target. The target can spend a move action on its turn to attempt a Reflex save against the wisp's Acrobatics DC to escape the shroud.

action->Stretch Shadow.name: Stretch Shadow
action->Stretch Shadow.description:
Requirements The shadow wisp is attached to a living creature.

Effect The shadow wisp slips into the attached creature's shadow, dealing it @Damage[1d6[void]] damage. It can use the attached creature's shadow to make a shadow tendril Strike against another target up to 10 feet away

action->Blood Magic.name: Blood Magic
action->Blood Magic.description: When a skeletal mage casts a spell, either it gains temporary Hit Points equal to the spell's rank for 1 round, or one target takes @Damage[1[void]] damage per spell rank (if the spell already deals void damage, combine this with the spell's initial damage before determining weaknesses and resistances).

action->Signature Spell.name: Signature Spell
action->Signature Spell.description: The skeletal mage can freely heighten the spells marked signature.

action->Widen Spell.name: Widen Spell
action->Widen Spell.description: The skeleton mage causes the next spell they cast to affect a wider area. If the next action they use is to Cast a Spell that has an area of a burst, cone, or line and does not have a duration, increase the area of that spell. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet (a burst with a smaller radius is not affected). Add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that is normally 15 feet or smaller, and add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

action->Explosive Death.name: Explosive Death
action->Explosive Death.description:
When the skeleton is destroyed, its bones shatter and explode as the necromantic energy holding it together is released.

Adjacent creatures take @Damage[2d6[slashing]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:13|basic] save.

action->Gallop.name: Gallop
action->Gallop.description: The mount Strides twice, with its Speed increased by 10 feet.

action->Undead Steed.name: Undead Steed
action->Undead Steed.description: Undead and creatures allied with them can Command a skeletal mount without needing to attempt a skill check.

action->Explosive Death.name: Explosive Death
action->Explosive Death.description:
When the skeleton is destroyed, its bones shatter and explode as the necromantic energy holding it together is released.

Adjacent creatures take @Damage[2d6[slashing]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:13|basic] save.

action->Bloody.name: Bloody
action->Bloody.description: The skeleton is covered in dripping blood and gains fast healing 1.

action->Explosive Death.name: Explosive Death
action->Explosive Death.description:
When the skeleton is destroyed, its bones shatter and explode as the necromantic energy holding it together is released.

Adjacent creatures take @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage @Check[reflex|dc:10|basic] save.

Smoldering Forest Fire.name: Smoldering Forest Fire
Smoldering Forest Fire.descriptionHazard: A fire engulfs a 10-foot-by-10-foot section of forest, then spreads on each of its turns.
Smoldering Forest Fire.disable:
A successful @Check[athletics|dc:13|name:Smother Fire|traits:hazard,environmental,fire], @Check[nature|dc:13|name:Smother Fire|traits:hazard,environmental,fire], or @Check[survival|dc:13|name:Smother Fire|traits:hazard,environmental,fire] check from an adjacent square is sufficient to smother one 5-foot-square of fire; each attempt is an Interact action. Dousing the flames automatically extinguishes one or more sections of fire, with no check. Water typically clears a 5-foot square if the amount is small (such as that from create water or hydraulic push). Larger amounts of water, such as a full bucket, typically douse a 10-foot-by-10-foot area (or 4 squares in some other shape). Throwing a bucket of water on flames requires an Interact action. A waterskin doesn't contain enough water to put out even 1 square of fire.

Cold can also put out fire, but only if the cold can affect an area; cold is usually less effective than water, so a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.EpxmUtLpCkE8R6KJ]{Frost Vial} typically puts out only 1 square of fire, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gYjPm7YwGtEa1oxh]{Ray of Frost} is ineffective.
Smoldering Forest Fire.routine: On its turn, the fire spreads into a number of additional squares equal to half the number of squares the fire currently occupies, minimum 1 square. The GM determines the squares the fire spreads into. Any creature that ends its turn next to the flames takes @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage, and any creature within the flames takes @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:13|basic|name:Smoldering Forest Fire|traits:hazard,environmental,fire] save for both). A creature can take damage from flames only once per round.

Sodden Floor.name: Sodden Floor
Sodden Floor.descriptionHazard: The floorboards here are rotting and soft, giving way and dropping anyone above into the hole below.
Sodden Floor.disable: @Check[crafting|dc:16|name:Reinforce Compromised Floorboards] (trained) to reinforce the compromised floorboards.

action->Crumble.name: Crumble
action->Crumble.description:
Trigger A creature walks onto any square containing the sodden floorboards.

Effect All squares with floorboards give way. Each creature in any of the marked squares must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:18] save.

Success The creature moves to the nearest safe square and avoids falling in.

Failure The creature falls 10 feet, takes 5 bludgeoning damage as a result of the fall, and is prone in the hole.

Spear Launcher (Q9:1-2).name: Spear Launcher (Q9:1-2)
Spear Launcher (Q9:1-2).descriptionHazard: A wall socket loaded with a spear connects to a floor tile in one 5-foot square.
Spear Launcher (Q9:1-2).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:18|name:Disable Spear Launcher] (trained) on the floor tile or wall socket

action->Spear.name: Spear
action->Spear.description:
Trigger Pressure is applied to the floor tile.

Effect The trap shoots a spear, making an attack against the creature or object on the floor tile.

Spear Launcher (Q9:3-4).name: Spear Launcher (Q9:3-4)
Spear Launcher (Q9:3-4).descriptionHazard: A wall socket loaded with a spear connects to a floor tile in one 5-foot square.
Spear Launcher (Q9:3-4).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:22|name:Disable Spear Launcher] (trained) on the floor tile or wall socket

action->Spear.name: Spear
action->Spear.description:
Trigger Pressure is applied to the floor tile.

Effect The trap shoots a spear, making an attack against the creature or object on the floor tile.

Spiky Pit (1-2).name: Spiky Pit (1-2)
Spiky Pit (1-2).descriptionHazard: A wooden trapdoor covers a pit that's 10 feet square and 20 feet deep.
Spiky Pit (1-2).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:12|name:Remove Trap Door|traits:mechanical,trap] to remove the trapdoor
Spiky Pit (1-2).reset: Creatures can still fall into the trap, but the trapdoor must be reset manually for the trap to become hidden again.

action->Pitfall.name: Pitfall
action->Pitfall.description:
Trigger A creature walks onto the trapdoor

Effect The triggering creature falls in and takes @Damage[10[bludgeoning]|options:fall-damage] damage plus @Damage[1d4[piercing]] damage from sharp implements at the bottom of the pit. That creature can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} reaction to avoid falling.

Spiky Pit (3-4).name: Spiky Pit (3-4)
Spiky Pit (3-4).descriptionHazard: A wooden trapdoor covers a pit that's 10 feet square and 20 feet deep.
Spiky Pit (3-4).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:12|name:Remove Trap Door|traits:mechanical,trap] to remove the trapdoor
Spiky Pit (3-4).reset: Creatures can still fall into the trap, but the trapdoor must be reset manually for the trap to become hidden again.

action->Pitfall.name: Pitfall
action->Pitfall.description:
Trigger A creature walks onto the trapdoor

Effect The triggering creature falls in and takes @Damage[10[bludgeoning]|options:fall-damage] damage plus @Damage[3d8[piercing]] damage from sharp implements at the bottom of the pit. That creature can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} reaction to avoid falling.

action->Construct Armor (Hardness 6).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 6)
action->Construct Armor (Hardness 6).description:
Like normal objects, a spirit guardian statue has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness.

Once the statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 16.

action->Follow Trespasser.name: Follow Trespasser
action->Follow Trespasser.description:
Trigger A creature moves through the animated guardian statue's reach.

Effect The statue moves up to 20 feet in pursuit of the creature.

Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (5-6).name: Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (5-6)
Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (5-6).descriptionHazard:
Four techno-organic "bush" structures featuring mini-acid pumps activate. The first lashes out with sharp "branches" as it activates, and then all of the bushes spit acid at movement nearby.

HP is 10 per bush with a BT of 5
Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (5-6).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:20|traits:action:disable-a-device] or @Check[engineering-lore|dc:20|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) on each bush to collapse its acid pump into component parts (2 actions per bush).
Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (5-6).routine: (3 actions) The trap loses 1 action each turn for each bush disabled. On each of the hazard's actions, one of the functional pumps spits acid at a creature within range. The bushes sense movement, only targeting creatures that moved from their space on their most recent turn. This trap does not attack any single creature more than once per round. It does not take a multiple attack penalty.

action->Jagged Branches.name: Jagged Branches
action->Jagged Branches.description:
Trigger A creature moves into a square adjacent to a bush

Effect The bush rakes its sharp branches across the creature, making a single branch Strike.

Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (7-8).name: Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (7-8)
Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (7-8).descriptionHazard:
Four techno-organic "bush"; structures featuring mini-acid pumps activate. The first lashes out with sharp "branches" as it activates, and then all of the bushes spit acid at movement nearby.

HP is 14 per bush with a BT of 7
Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (7-8).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:23|traits:action:disable-a-device] or @Check[engineering-lore|dc:23|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) on each bush to collapse its acid pump into component parts (2 actions per bush).
Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (7-8).routine: (3 Actions) The trap loses 1 action each turn for each bush disabled. On each of the hazard's actions, one of the functional pumps spits acid at a creature within range. The bushes sense movement, and they only target creatures that moved from their space on their most recent turn. This trap does not attack any single creature more than once per round. It does not take a multiple attack penalty.

action->Jagged Branches.name: Jagged Branches
action->Jagged Branches.description:
Trigger A creature moves into a square adjacent to a bush

Effect The adjacent bush rakes its sharp branches across the creature, making a single branch Strike.

Squirrel Swarm (1-04).name: Squirrel Swarm (1-04)
Squirrel Swarm (1-04).publicNotes: Swarms of centipedes are dangerous indeed, ravenous carpets of skittering hunger capable of devouring a traveler whole in a matter of minutes. Some alchemists submerge whole centipedes taken from swarms in their elixirs and some mutagens, claiming such infusions increase potency, though other say this is nothing more than quackish claptrap. Kobolds and mitflits are both known to incorporate swarms of centipedes into cunning traps, from simple pits filled with vermin or more complex affairs involving chutes that dump the vermin onto the heads of unwary intruders.
Squirrel Swarm (1-04).privateNotes:
Squirrel Swarm size is incorrect in the PDF and was corrected to be large.

https://paizo.com/threads/rzs42s73?PFS-104-Bandits-of-Immenwood#10

action->Swarming Claws and Teeth.name: Swarming Claws and Teeth
action->Swarming Claws and Teeth.description:
Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[1d4[piercing]] damage and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:17|traits:damaging-effect] save.

A creature affected by this attack can spend 2 actions on it's turn to attempt another @Check[reflex|dc:17] to remove the clumsy condition.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, is clumsy 2, and falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

action->Construct Armor (Hardness 10).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 10)
action->Construct Armor (Hardness 10).description:
Like normal objects, the statue of Set has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness.

Once the statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 20.

action->Brazier.name: Brazier
action->Brazier.description:
The statue carries a wide brazier full of hot coals. To make flaming coal Strikes or use Burn Alive, the statue must have the brazier held in one hand or otherwise have it within reach.

Instead of targeting the statue with an attack, a creature can target the brazier directly. The brazier has the same AC and saves as the statue.

Dealing 15 cold damage to the brazier or dousing it with at least 2 gallons of water extinguishes the coals. This prevents the statue from using Burn Alive and causes its ranged attacks to no longer deal 2d8 fire damage.

action->Burn Alive.name: Burn Alive
action->Burn Alive.description: The statue grinds a creature it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} into the red-hot coals of its brazier. The target takes @Damage[3d6[fire],1d8[persistent,fire]] damage.

Steaming Fields (5-6).name: Steaming Fields (5-6)
Steaming Fields (5-6).descriptionHazard: A field of warm mist covers an open plain. Pockets of highly pressurized steam lie @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} in the earth; pressure releases jets of steam.
Steaming Fields (5-6).disable: @Check[survival|dc:26] (expert) twice to navigate a safe path

action->Steam Jet.name: Steam Jet
action->Steam Jet.description:
Trigger A creature fails a skill check to navigate through the steaming field

Effect Several jets of pressurized steam erupt, dealing @Damage[(2d6+6)[bludgeoning],(2d6+6)[fire]]{2d6+6 bludgeoning damage and 2d6+6 fire damage} to creatures within 30 feet of the ground (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic]).

Steaming Fields (7-8).name: Steaming Fields (7-8)
Steaming Fields (7-8).descriptionHazard: A field of warm mist covers an open plain. Pockets of highly pressurized steam lie @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} in the earth; pressure releases jets of steam.
Steaming Fields (7-8).disable: @Check[survival|dc:30] (expert) twice to navigate a safe path

action->Steam Jet.name: Steam Jet
action->Steam Jet.description:
Trigger A creature fails a skill check to navigate through the steaming field

Effect Several jets of pressurized steam erupt, dealing @Damage[(3d6+10)[bludgeoning],(3d6+10)[fire]]{3d6+10 bludgeoning damage and 3d6+10 fire damage} to creatures within 30 feet of the ground (@Check[reflex|dc:27|basic]).

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description: The steel mephit breathes shards of iron in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[2d4[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|options:area-effect] save). Creatures who fail their save against this effect also take @Damage[1d6[bleed]]. The steel mephit can't use its breath weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge breath weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

weapon->Scimitar.name: Scimitar
weapon->Scimitar.description: This one-handed curved blade is sharp on one side.

armor->Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
armor->Studded Leather Armor.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

action->Storm Smite.name: Storm Smite
action->Storm Smite.description:
Trigger The storm acolyte critically hits with a scimitar Strike

Effect The storm acolyte releases a blast of lighting in a @Template[burst|distance:10] centered on the target. A creature in the area other than the storm acolyte takes @Damage[1d6[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:13|basic] save). On a critical failure, such a creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 round.

weapon->Scimitar.description: This one-handed curved blade is sharp on one side.

armor->Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
armor->Studded Leather Armor.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

action->Storm Smite.description:

On a critical failure, such a creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 round.

Submerged Shard.name: Submerged Shard
Submerged Shard.descriptionHazard: An immense, jagged piece of clear crystal 10 feet square and forty feet high juts up from the seafloor
Submerged Shard.disable: @Check[survival|dc:13|name:Blunt Crystal] (trained) to blunt the crystal's edges without getting cut
Submerged Shard.reset: The hazard still damages any creature or object that enters its space, but the surface doesn't become hidden again until it settles over the course of 1 minute.

action->Shard.name: Shard
action->Shard.description:
Trigger A creature or object moves into the shard's space.

Effect The triggering creature takes @Damage[(2d6+5)[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save).

Summoning Rune (PFS 1-11).name: Summoning Rune (PFS 1-11)
Summoning Rune (PFS 1-11).descriptionHazard: A cloud of invisible magical sensors covers four squares on the map. One of these hazards is in the squares directly above each of the four yellow runes on the map, and the other is in the squares directly above each of the four blue runes on the map.
Summoning Rune (PFS 1-11).disable: @Check[acrobatics|dc:15] to approach without triggering the trap followed by @Check[thievery|dc:17] (trained) to erase the rune, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (1st level; counteract DC 15) to counteract the rune
Summoning Rune (PFS 1-11).reset: The trap resets each day at dawn.

action->Summon Monster.name: Summon Monster
action->Summon Monster.description:
Trigger A creature enters the cloud of magical sensors.

Effect This trap summons a specific level 1 creature, determined when the trap is created. The squares above the yellow runes summon a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.k9fM0vufbdsDPQul]{Fire Mephit}, while the squares above the blue runes summon an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.yPYQC2bfOYmqcfIB]{Imp}. The creature rolls initiative and remains for [[/br 2d6 #Rounds]]{2d6 rounds}, after which the spell ends and the creature disappears. The creature also disappears if someone disables the trap before the duration expires. The summoned creature can use 3 actions each round and can use reactions, unlike most summoned creatures.

weapon->+1 Handwraps of Mighty Blows.name: +1 Handwraps of Mighty Blows
weapon->+1 Handwraps of Mighty Blows.description:
As you invest these embroidered strips of cloth, you must meditate and slowly wrap them around your hands. These handwraps have weapon runes etched into them to give your unarmed attacks the benefits of those runes, making your unarmed attacks work like magic weapons. For example, +1 striking handwraps of mighty blows would give you a +1 item bonus to attack rolls with your unarmed attacks and increase the damage of your unarmed attacks from one weapon die to two (normally 2d4 instead of 1d4, but if your fists have a different weapon damage die or you have other unarmed attacks, use two of that die size instead).

You can upgrade, add, and transfer runes to and from the handwraps just as you would for a weapon, and you can attach talismans to the handwraps. Treat the handwraps as melee weapons of the brawling group with light Bulk for these purposes. Property runes apply only when they would be applicable to the unarmed attack you're using. For example, a property that must be applied to a slashing weapon wouldn't function when you attacked with a fist, but you would gain its benefits if you attacked with a claw or some other slashing unarmed attack.

action->Construct Armor (Hardness 10).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 10)
action->Construct Armor (Hardness 10).description: Like normal objects, Synthetic Khismar has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage he takes by an amount equal to his Hardness. Once Synthetic Khismar is reduced to fewer than half his Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, his construct armor breaks and his AC is reduced to 20.

action->Overcharge.name: Overcharge
action->Overcharge.description:
Trigger Synthetic Khismar takes electricity damage

Effect Synthetic Khismar gains resistance 20 to electricity against the triggering attack and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for [[/gmr 1d4 #Quickened Duration]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Programmed Combo.name: Programmed Combo
action->Programmed Combo.description: Synthetic Khismar makes two storm-fist Strikes against a single target. If either of the attacks deals damage, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the beginning of Synthetic Khismar's next turn. His multiple attack penalty increases after making both attacks.

action->Self-Destruct.name: Self-Destruct
action->Self-Destruct.description:
Requirements Synthetic Khismar has 20 HP or fewer

Effect Synthetic Khismar explodes in a ball of burning plasma, destroying himself completely and dealing @Damage[8d6[electricity]] damage to all creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:10] (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic])

Special Synthetic Khismar automatically activates this ability as a free action when brought to 0 Hit Points.

action->Technology Control.name: Technology Control
action->Technology Control.description:
Frequency once per turn

Range 100 feet

Effect Synthetic Khismar chooses the target of one technological construct or hazard; if this would cause the technological construct or hazard to attack a creature it would not normally attack, it takes a -2 circumstance penalty to its attack rolls and DCs against that creature.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.2ccLQxmTlTPySnOR]{Effect: Technology Control}

action->Voltaic Surge.name: Voltaic Surge
action->Voltaic Surge.description:
Trigger The technic zombie critically hits a creature with a fist Strike

Effect The Technic zombie releases a jolt of electricity through its fist, dealing @Damage[1d8[electricity]] damage to the target. Additionally, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for 1 round (@Check[reflex|dc:15|traits:damaging-effect] negates)

Frequency once per minute

Frequency once per minute

action->Covetous Flames.name: Covetous Flames
action->Covetous Flames.description: Any weapon the ascendant holds gains the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.XszNvxnymWYRaoTp]{Flaming} rune while they hold it.

action->Furious Wings.name: Furious Wings
action->Furious Wings.description: The ascendant beats their wings in a frenzied motion, creating a powerful blast of wind that disperses fog and gases and blows objects of light Bulk or less away. All creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} of the ascendant must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:24] save or be pushed 5 feet away from the ascendant, or 10 feet on a critical failure. A flying creature that fails its save gets a critical failure instead.

action->Covetous Flames.name: Covetous Flames
action->Covetous Flames.description: Any weapon the ascendant holds gains the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.XszNvxnymWYRaoTp]{Flaming} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.DxCuJKynlnMQZHgp]{Striking} rune while they hold it.

action->Furious Wings.name: Furious Wings
action->Furious Wings.description: The ascendant beats their wings in a frenzied motion, creating a powerful blast of wind that disperses fog and gases, blows objects of light Bulk or less away. All creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} of the ascendant must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:23] save or be pushed 5 feet away from the ascendant, or 10 feet on a critical failure. A flying creature that fails its save gets a critical failure instead.

action->Feed on Thoughts.name: Feed on Thoughts
action->Feed on Thoughts.description: The cocoon unravels as it envelops a Small, Medium, or Large humanoid creature that's unconscious, willing, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by Hypnotic Thrum, and that is within reach of the cocoon's tendrils, moving into the creature's space as part of this action. The creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} and take @Damage[1d12[mental],1d12[slashing]]{1d12 mental damage and 1d12 slashing damage} (double damage on a critical failure). Feeding on a creature's Thoughts doesn't end fascination caused by Hypnotic Thrum.

action->Hypnotic Thrum.name: Hypnotic Thrum
action->Hypnotic Thrum.description:
The thorned cocoon relays Qxal's telepathic coercions in either a @Template[line|distance:30] or a @Template[cone|distance:15]. Each creature in the emanation must attempt a @Check[will|dc:18] save. Once a creature succeeds at any save against Hypnotic Thrum, it becomes temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated}. For as long as it is fascinated, it must spend each of its actions to move closer to the thorned cocoon as expediently as possible, while avoiding obvious dangers. If the creature is adjacent to the thorned cocoon, it stays still and doesn't act.

Critical Failure As failure, but the condition doesn't end automatically. The creature can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns. On a success, the fascinated condition ends.

action->Feed on Thoughts.name: Feed on Thoughts
action->Feed on Thoughts.description: The cocoon unravels as it envelops a Small, Medium, or Large humanoid creature that's unconscious, willing, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by Hypnotic Thrum, and that is within reach of the cocoon's tendrils, moving into the creature's space as part of this action. The creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:21] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} and take @Damage[2d6[mental],2d6[slashing]]{2d6 mental damage and 2d6 slashing damage} (double damage on a critical failure). Feeding on a creature's Thoughts doesn't end fascination caused by Hypnotic Thrum.

action->Powerful Charge.name: Powerful Charge
action->Powerful Charge.description:
The mountain goat Strides up to double its Speed in a straight line and then makes a horn attack.

If the mountain goat moved at least 20 feet, its Push increases to 10 feet on a hit.

strike-melee->Jaws.name: Jaws
strike-melee->Jaws.description: The first creature hit by a snapjaw is affected by the Pesticide poison.

action->Pesticide.name: Pesticide
action->Pesticide.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:17]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d4[poison]] damage and enfeebled 1 (1 round)

strike-melee->Jaws.name: Jaws
strike-melee->Jaws.description: The first creature hit by a snapjaw is affected by the Pesticide poison.

action->Pesticide.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:20]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d8[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d12[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Trapmaster Tok's Surprise (1-2).name: Trapmaster Tok's Surprise (1-2)
Trapmaster Tok's Surprise (1-2).descriptionHazard: Pressure sensitive panels in the floor connect to a barrel of debris hidden in the hallway's ceiling
Trapmaster Tok's Surprise (1-2).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:20|name:Disable Floor Panels|traits:mechanical,trap] (trained) on the floor panels before the barrel falls

action->Falling Debris.name: Falling Debris
action->Falling Debris.description:
Trigger Pressure is placed on any floor tile

Effect The barrel of debris tips over and showers broken glass down. The glass deals @Damage[2d8[slashing]] damage and @Damage[1[bleed]] damage(@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|name:Dodge Falling Debris|traits:mechanical,trap] save) to all creatures within 10 feet.

Trapmaster Tok's Surprise (3-4).name: Trapmaster Tok's Surprise (3-4)
Trapmaster Tok's Surprise (3-4).descriptionHazard: Pressure sensitive panels in the floor connect to a barrel of debris hidden in the hallway's ceiling
Trapmaster Tok's Surprise (3-4).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:23|name:Disable Floor Panels|traits:mechanical,trap] (trained) on the floor panels before the barrel falls

action->Falling Debris.name: Falling Debris
action->Falling Debris.description:
Trigger Pressure is placed on any floor tile

Effect The barrel of debris tips over and showers broken glass down. The glass deals @Damage[3d8[slashing]] damage and @Damage[2[bleed]] damage(@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|name:Dodge Falling Debris|traits:mechanical,trap] save) to all creatures within 10 feet.

Treacherous Quagmire.name: Treacherous Quagmire
Treacherous Quagmire.descriptionHazard: A patch of treacherous bog attempts to submerge creatures that step onto it.
Treacherous Quagmire.disable: @Check[survival|dc:18|name:Disturb Surface|traits:secret,action:sense-direction,exploration] (trained) to disturb the surface and make the quagmire plainly visible.
Treacherous Quagmire.reset: The hazard still submerges anyone who walks in, but the surface doesn't become hidden again until it settles over the course of 24 hours
Treacherous Quagmire.routine:
(1 action) On its initiative, the quagmire pulls each creature within it 1 square toward the center of the quagmire and 1 step further submerged; a creature that is submerged up to its waist becomes submerged up to its neck, and a creature that is submerged up to its neck is pulled under and has to hold its breath to avoid suffocation.

A creature in the quagmire can attempt a @Check[athletics|dc:20|name:Swim Out of Quagmire|traits:environmental,hazard,action:swim] check to Swim to either raise itself by 1 step if its submerged to its neck or worse, or to swim out of the quagmire if its submerged up to only its waist. On a critical failure, the creature is pulled down 1 step. A creature that Swims out of the quagmire escapes the hazard and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} adjacent to the quagmire. Other creatures can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid} the creature, typically by using a rope or similar tool, or attempt to pull a creature within their reach out with a @Check[athletics|dc:20|name:Pull Out of Quagmire|traits:environmental,hazard,action:aid] check, with the same results as if the creature attempted the check.

action->Submerge.name: Submerge
action->Submerge.description:
Trigger A Small or larger creature walks into a quagmire.

Effect The triggering creature sinks into the quagmire up to its waist in its current square. The quagmire rolls initiative if it hasn't already.

Unkillable Zombie Brute (PFS 1-01).name: Unkillable Zombie Brute (PFS 1-01)
Unkillable Zombie Brute (PFS 1-01).publicNotes:
Necromantic augmentations have granted this zombie increased size and power.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Corpse Throwing.name: Corpse Throwing
action->Corpse Throwing.description: A zombie hulk can throw corpses at foes. While any Medium dead body will do, they sometimes throw @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.Xo4IGzw28hivgMmM]{Zombie Shamblers}, who take just as much damage from being thrown as the target they hit. A thrown shambler lands @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, but if it's not destroyed, it can rise and use other actions normally.

action->Wide Swing.name: Wide Swing
action->Wide Swing.description: The zombie hulk makes a hunk of meat Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within the Strike's reach. This attack counts as two attacks for the zombie hulk's multiple attack penalty.

Unkillable Zombie Brute (PFS 1-13).name: Unkillable Zombie Brute (PFS 1-13)
Unkillable Zombie Brute (PFS 1-13).publicNotes:
Necromantic augmentations have granted this zombie increased size and power.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

condition->Slowed.name: Slowed
condition->Slowed.description: You have fewer actions. Slowed always includes a value. When you regain your actions at the start of your turn, reduce the number of actions you regain by your slowed value. Because slowed has its effect at the start of your turn, you don't immediately lose actions if you become slowed during your turn.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

equipment->Holly and Mistletoe.name: Holly and Mistletoe
equipment->Holly and Mistletoe.description: Plants of supernatural significance provide a primal focus for primal spellcasters, such as druids, when using certain abilities and casting some spells. A bundle of holly and mistletoe must be held in one hand to use it. Other primal foci exist for druids focused on other aspects of nature.

consumable->Scroll of Entangle (Level 2).name: Scroll of Entangle (Level 2)
consumable->Scroll of Entangle (Level 2).description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.J6vNvrUT3b1hx2iA]{Entangling Flora}

Casting a Spell from a scroll requires holding the scroll in one hand and activating it with a Cast a Spell activity using the normal number of actions for that spell.

To Cast a Spell from a scroll, the spell must appear on your spell list. Because you're the one Casting the Spell, use your spell attack roll and spell DC. The spell also gains the appropriate trait for your tradition (arcane, divine, occult, or primal).

Any physical material components and costs are provided when a scroll is created, so you don't need to provide them when Casting a Spell from a scroll. You must replace any required material component for that spell with a somatic component. If the spell requires a focus, you must have that focus to Cast the Spell from a scroll.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.

action->Storm Born.name: Storm Born
action->Storm Born.description: Vengeant Thorn has an innate connection to storms. He does not take circumstance penalties to ranged spell attacks or Perception checks caused by weather, and his targeted spells ignore concealment caused by weather (such as fog).

Vengeful Spirits.name: Vengeful Spirits
Vengeful Spirits.descriptionHazard: A cadre of evil spirits assails people's minds throughout the stretch of forest. The spirits first afflict their hosts with visceral images of their own deaths, then try to recreate their deaths by forcing their hosts to inflict similar wounds upon themselves. Creatures frightened by the haunt appear to have ephemeral masks with horns, tusks, and yellow eyes over their faces.
Vengeful Spirits.disable: Two @Check[occultism|dc:26|name:Exorcise the Haunt|traits:hazard,haunt,complex] or @Check[religion|dc:26|name:Exorcise the Haunt|traits:hazard,haunt,complex] (trained) to exorcise the spirits. A creature can either inflict 4 mental damage to the haunt or permanently lower the DC of checks to exorcise the spirits 1 by succeeding at a @Check[diplomacy|dc:22|name:Calm the Spirits|traits:hazard,haunt,complex] check to calm the spirits, a @Check[nature|dc:22|name:Ward Against the Spirits|traits:hazard,haunt,complex] check to use kami-specific warding incantations, a @Check[occultism|dc:20|name:Leverage Haunt Lore|traits:hazard,haunt,complex] check to leverage obscure haunt lore, or a @Check[religion|dc:22|name:Lesser Exorcism to Weaken the Haunt|traits:hazard,haunt,complex] check to use a lesser exorcism. Any creature currently frightened by the haunt is a potential target for inflicting damage to the haunt; mental and vitality damage only affect such a host creature if they choose to be affected, while force or similar damage harms both the haunt and the host equally.
Vengeful Spirits.routine:
(3 actions) On its initiative, the haunt uses its first two actions to attempt to terrify a random target in its area that is not already @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:22|name:Resist Terror|traits:emotion,fear,mental,hazard,haunt] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune to this haunt for 24 hours.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The target is frightened 1. The value of the frightened condition does not automatically decrease by 1 at the end of each of the target's turns. Instead, the target can attempt a @Check[will|dc:18|name:Reduce Frightened|traits:emotion,fear,mental,hazard,haunt] save at the end of each of their turns to lower their frightened value by 1.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}. The value of the frightened condition does not automatically decrease by 1 at the end of each of the target's turns. Instead, the target can attempt a @Check[will|dc:18|name:Reduce Frightened|traits:emotion,fear,mental,hazard,haunt] save at the end of each of their turns to lower their frightened value by 1.

The haunt then spends an action to compels one of the creatures that it has frightened to harm itself with surrounding forest debris, its strength fueled by spirit possession. The creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:22|name:Resist Attacking Yourself|traits:emotion,fear,mental,hazard,haunt] save or attempt to Strike itself during its turn as its first action, using the haunt's statistics below. Note that frightened applies equally to the creature's attack roll and AC, and therefore does not affect the accuracy of the attack.

action->Visions of Death.name: Visions of Death
action->Visions of Death.description:
Trigger Three or more creatures enter the haunt's area

Effect Spectral faces appear, and the haunt rolls initiative.

action->Power Attack.name: Power Attack
action->Power Attack.description:
The guard captain makes a melee Strike.

This counts as two attacks when calculating the multiple attack penalty. If this Strike hits, it deals an extra a die of weapon damage.

action->Sudden Charge.name: Sudden Charge
action->Sudden Charge.description: The guard captain Strides twice. If the guard captain ends their movement within a melee reach of at least one enemy, they can make a melee Strike against that enemy.

action->Swipe.name: Swipe
action->Swipe.description: The guard captain makes a single melee Strike and compares the attack roll result to the ACs of up to two foes, each of whom must be within the guard captain's melee reach and adjacent to the other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature the guard captain hits. A swipe counts as two attacks for the multiple attack penalty. The modifier of a weapon with a sweep trait applies to all attacks.

action->Pounce.name: Pounce
action->Pounce.description: The vicious vulpine Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the fox begins this action hidden, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: A vicious vulpine deals 1d4 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Lunge.name: Lunge
action->Lunge.description: The guard makes a Strike with a melee weapon, extending their reach by 5 feet for that Strike. If the weapon has the disarm, shove, or trip trait, the guard can use the corresponding action instead of a Strike.

action->Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 30 fee.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet
action->Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 30 fee.description: A voidworm can anticipate the most likely presence of a creature through a supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants it the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. A creature under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that is otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions cannot be noticed via entropy sense.

action->Protean Anatomy.name: Protean Anatomy
action->Protean Anatomy.description:
A protean's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the protean takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first. The protean is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the protean automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.c6SiBB3mzV8lZUQr]{Effect: Protean Anatomy}

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description:
The voidworm takes on the appearance of a Tiny animal. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Confounding Lash.name: Confounding Lash
action->Confounding Lash.description: A creature hit by the voidworm's tail Strike is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical hit). A successful @Check[will|dc:22] save negates this effect and grants temporary immunity to confounding lash for 1 minute.

action->Divide.name: Divide
action->Divide.description: In any round the voidworm ouroboros has less than half its total Hit Points, it can split into two standard @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.ciLdEf6sld8h2a2j]{Voidworms} which assume normal statistics for that creature.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The rebel deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
action->Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the rebel.

weapon->Stone Longsword.name: Stone Longsword
weapon->Stone Longsword.description: Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.

shield->Large Bark Shield.name: Large Bark Shield
shield->Large Bark Shield.description:
Though they come in a variety of shapes and sizes, the protection offered by wooden shields comes from the stoutness of their materials. While wooden shields are less expensive than steel shields, they break more easily.

Hardness HP BT
3 20 10

action->Axe Vulnerability.name: Axe Vulnerability
action->Axe Vulnerability.description: An arboreal warden takes 5 additional damage from axes.

action->Shield Push.name: Shield Push
action->Shield Push.description: The arboreal warden Strides and then makes a shield bash Strike. If the attack hits, the target is pushed 10 feet.

Weak Ceustodaemon (PFS 1-01).name: Weak Ceustodaemon (PFS 1-01)
Weak Ceustodaemon (PFS 1-01).publicNotes:
Ceustodaemons are formed from the souls of vile mortals, particularly those who took efforts to hasten their own death, their willingness shaping them into daemonic servants. Their otherworldly senses make them useful for protecting vaults and similar locations on the Material Plane. Ceustodaemons are created to serve, but always seek ways to subvert their bindings, so they can rend their mortal summoners' flesh. The worst type of conjurer calls upon ceustodaemons merely to set them free into the world in hopes of currying favor with the powers of Abaddon.

Denizens of the bleak and terrible plane of Abaddon, daemons are shaped by and devoted to the destruction of life in all its forms. They seek the death of every mortal being by the most painful and horrible means possible, all in service to the apocalyptic entities known as the Four Horsemen. Each kind of daemon represents a different way to die, and their powers are nearly always aimed at spreading that particular form of death. Through the use of these powers, they seek to drag all existence down into a pit of hopelessness and despair, and to commit all souls to oblivion.

While those who summon daemons to the Material Plane usually seek to use the creatures' destructive and corrupting powers for their own ends, daemons always look for ways to spread fear, doubt, and despair wherever they go. Often, daemons disguise their plots as the workings of other fiends, knowing that such confusion compounds mortals' fear.

While all fiends seek to tempt mortals into lives of evil to increase their own numbers and power on their native planes, daemons are further driven by a supernatural hunger for mortal souls and use a variety of methods-not least of which is the cacodaemons' soul gems-to entrap them. On Abaddon and in other forbidding places across the multiverse, souls are simultaneously a delicacy, a trade good, and a source of magical power, and the daemons are among the greatest gluttons, merchants, and abusers of this spiritual "resource."

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description:
The ceustodaemon breathes flames in a @Template[cone|distance:30]. Creatures in the cone take @Damage[6d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|options:area-effect] save).

The ceustodaemon and each creature that fails the save catch fire, taking @Damage[1d6[persistent,fire]] damage.

The breath weapon can't be used again for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Drawn to Service.name: Drawn to Service
action->Drawn to Service.description: When bringing a ceustodaemon to another plane with effects like a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2ykmAVKrsAWcazcC]{Binding Circle} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vgy00hnqxN9VoeoF]{Planar Servitor} ritual, the primary and secondary skill DCs are reduced by 5, and the ceustodaemon demands only half the normal cost for its service.

action->Vicious Wounds.name: Vicious Wounds
action->Vicious Wounds.description:
On a successful jaws or claw Strike, the ceustodaemon viciously tears into its victim as similar wounds appear on its own body. The target takes an extra [[/r {1d6}]]{1d6 amount of damage}, and the ceustodaemon takes the same extra damage.

If this extra damage to the target is doubled, due to a critical hit, the ceustodaemon takes double damage as well.

Weak Green Hag.name: Weak Green Hag
Weak Green Hag.publicNotes:
Green hags hate beauty and purity, so they use disguises and treachery to lure and murder innocents, corrupt the pure of heart, and shatter the minds and morals of their victims. Green hags create imaginative schemes to utterly ruin anyone who crosses them, as well as good or righteous folk whose very existence insults the hag's twisted sensibilities. The complicated scandals perpetuated by green hags involve impersonation, mistaken identity, the seduction and betrayal of loved ones, or all these things in combination.

Malevolent crones who lurk at the edges of civilization, hags use their deceptive, magical abilities to prey upon humanoids, manipulating and corrupting them. Some say hags arose from fey that became twisted by their inner selfishness. Hags gather together in covens for greater power, craft unique magical items known as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ACa9QlFqdmW4s2Th]{Hag Eyes}, and are known to replace infant humanoids with their own offspring-these children are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.RqX0vfUjlycKjGyp]{Changelings} who have the potential to become hags themselves.
Weak Green Hag.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->Coven.name: Coven
action->Coven.description:
A green hag adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.J6vNvrUT3b1hx2iA]{Entangling Flora}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KSAEhNfZyXMO7Z7V]{Outcast's Curse}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KsWhliKfUs3IpW3c]{Wall of Thorns} to her coven's spells.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Coven]

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Sound Imitation.name: Sound Imitation
action->Sound Imitation.description: A green hag who succeeds at a Deception check to Lie can mimic the sounds of any animal found near her lair. She has a +4 circumstance bonus to this check.

action->Betraying Touch.name: Betraying Touch
action->Betraying Touch.description: The green hag touches a creature that doesn't realize the hag is an enemy. The betrayed creature is affected by the hag's enfeebling humors and takes a -4 circumstance penalty to their saving throw against that effect.

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description:
The green hag can take on the appearance of any Medium humanoid woman. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage bonuses with her Strikes, but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Enfeebling Humors.name: Enfeebling Humors
action->Enfeebling Humors.description: A creature damaged by a hag's claw must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 day. On a critical failure, or if it gets hit again and fails its save a second time, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 day.

action->Exhale Miasma.name: Exhale Miasma
action->Exhale Miasma.description:
The green hag exhales a miasma of green vapors. Each living creature in a @Template[cone|distance:15] is affected by her enfeebling humors (attemping a save as normal).

She can't use Exhale Miasma again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Exhale Miasma]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Homunculus Poison.name: Homunculus Poison
action->Homunculus Poison.description:
A homunculus has one dose of poison in a reservoir in its head. It can refill this poison from its reserves with an Interact action.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:13]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Weak Spider Swarm.name: Weak Spider Swarm
Weak Spider Swarm.publicNotes:
An abundance of food, the sudden hatching of a clutch of eggs, or magical influence can cause smaller spiders to gather in terrifying, deadly masses.

Few everyday vermin inspire as much dread as the infamous spider.

action->Spider Swarm Venom.name: Spider Swarm Venom
action->Spider Swarm Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:13]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d4[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round).

action->Swarming Bites.name: Swarming Bites
action->Swarming Bites.description: Each enemy in the spider swarm's space takes @Damage[(1d4-1)[piercing]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:13|basic] save. A creature that fails its save is exposed to spider swarm venom.

action->Circling Attack.name: Circling Attack
action->Circling Attack.description: The zephyr hawk Flies up to half its Speed, makes two wing Strikes, then Flies up to half its Speed again to return to its original location. The second half of this movement doesn't trigger reactions. Both attacks count toward the zephyr hawk's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after it makes both attacks.

weapon->+1 Scepter (functions as club).name: +1 Scepter (functions as club)
weapon->+1 Scepter (functions as club).description: This is a piece of stout wood shaped or repurposed to bludgeon an enemy. Clubs can be intricately carved pieces of martial art or as simple as a tree branch or piece of wood.

equipment->Regal Vestments.name: Regal Vestments
equipment->Regal Vestments.description: Fine clothing, suitable for a noble or royal, is made with expensive fabrics, precious metals, and intricate patterns.

action->Bespell Primal Weapon.name: Bespell Primal Weapon
action->Bespell Primal Weapon.description:
Frequency once per turn

Requirements Webhekiz's most recent action was to cast a non-cantrip spell. Effect Webhekiz channels primal energy into his scepter or another wooden weapon, causing it to bloom a poisonous flower or sprout prickly thorns. Until the end of Webhekiz's turn, the weapon deals an extra @Damage[1d6[poison]] or @Damage[1d6[piercing]] damage.

action->Squad Tactics.name: Squad Tactics
action->Squad Tactics.description: Webhekiz directs his guards to a more strategic position. Each guard can spend their reaction to Stride.

weapon->+1 Striking Scepter (functions a.name: +1 Striking Scepter (functions as club)
weapon->+1 Striking Scepter (functions a.description: This is a piece of stout wood shaped or repurposed to bludgeon an enemy. Clubs can be intricately carved pieces of martial art or as simple as a tree branch or piece of wood.

equipment->Regal Vestments.description: Fine clothing, suitable for a noble or royal, is made with expensive fabrics, precious metals, and intricate patterns.

action->Bespell Primal Weapon.description:
Frequency once per turn

Requirements Webhekiz's most recent action was to cast a non-cantrip spell. Until the end of Webhekiz's turn, the weapon deals an extra @Damage[1d6[poison]] or @Damage[1d6[piercing]] damage.

action->Squad Tactics.description: Webhekiz directs his guards to a more strategic position. Each guard can spend their reaction to Stride.

Whispering Souls.name: Whispering Souls
Whispering Souls.descriptionHazard: Lost spirits whisper, reliving their last moments, ready to drag the living into their illusion.
Whispering Souls.disable: @Check[religion|dc:19|name:Supress the Spirits] (trained) to suppress the spirits or @Check[performance|dc:19|name:Drown Out the Spirits] (trained) to drown them out
Whispering Souls.reset: The underlying spirits remain, resetting the haunt every midnight, until what truly happened here becomes public.
Whispering Souls.stealth: (trained) to hear the whispers from a distance

action->Luring Whispers.name: Luring Whispers
action->Luring Whispers.description:
Trigger Multiple creatures remain in area C4 for more than 6 seconds.

Effect The whispers become more insistent until each character in the room must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21] save.

On a failure, a creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (or for [[/gmr 1d4+2 #rounds]]{1d4+2 rounds} on a critical failure). Both the audible whispers and the babbling of the confused are related to the haunting's origin.

Owners Whispers and Babbles
Archdevil worshippers Desperate praise of Mephistopheles

Alchemical experimenters Frantic claims of not wanting to live forever anymore
Slavers Begging to be allowed to be released in multiple languages
Crime lords Promising not to mess with the family again
Misguided Pharasmins Sighing desires to be put to rest

Witchwyrd (PFS 1-21).name: Witchwyrd (PFS 1-21)
Witchwyrd (PFS 1-21).publicNotes:
Witchwyrds conceal most of their faces, leaving only their eyes unmasked. Their inscrutability is a boon to one of their most significant interests-mercantilism- and many haughty witchwyrds openly revel in the befuddlement inspired by their mysterious guises and mannerisms. Witchwyrds have a keen eye for new opportunities and markets, and a witchwyrd almost always knows when someone is trying to pull one over on them.

These four-armed humanoid creatures have hairless blue-gray skin, are typically 6-1/2 feet tall, and weigh 300 pounds. Their hands have three evenly sized and spaced digits in a tripod-like arrangement. When not trying to blend in with the local community, witchwyrds favor outlandish, loose-fitting clothes in bright reds or yellows and a signature conical hat. They tend to prefer the driest, warmest regions of the lands they visit-perhaps an indicator of their mysterious home world. This, however, is the only indicator; witchwyrds are notoriously close-mouthed about details of this distant world, and with good reason: most witchwyrds on Golarion have never visited their ancestral home. To these witchwyrds, the notion of a home planet is a constant thorn in their side, and when asked, many choose to ignore the question altogether. Others are so agitated by these queries that they respond with impatience or even violence. Some scholars have theorized a connection between witchwyrds and several other four-armed creatures, but like with questions of their place of origin, witchwyrds have little to say about the topic.
Witchwyrd (PFS 1-21).languagesDetails: one or more planar languages; tongues

weapon->+1 Ranseur.name: +1 Ranseur
weapon->+1 Ranseur.description: This polearm is a long trident with a central prong that's longer than the other two.

action->Absorb Force.name: Absorb Force
action->Absorb Force.description:
Frequency once per round

Trigger A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage} is fired at the witchwyrd, and the witchwyrd is aware of it and has a free hand

Effect The witchwyrd "catches" the missile, absorbing it and causing that hand to glow while it holds this energy. A hand that's holding energy can't be used for any other purpose except to use Force Bolt. The energy lasts for 6 rounds or until it is released.

action->Force Bolt.name: Force Bolt
action->Force Bolt.description:
1 to 3 actions

The witchwyrd fires one @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage} per action spent (dealing @Damage[(1d4+1)[force]] damage each). They can't spend more actions on this ability than they have free hands. If they use a hand that has Absorbed Force, that hand hurls two missiles instead of one, expending the held energy.

lore->One or more Lore skills related to.name: One or more Lore skills related to a specific plane

armor->Shoddy Breastplate.name: Shoddy Breastplate
armor->Shoddy Breastplate.description: Though referred to as a breastplate, this type of armor consists of several pieces of plate or half-plate armor that protect the torso, chest, neck, and sometimes the hips and lower legs. It strategically grants some of the protection of plate while allowing greater flexibility and speed.

Young Bloodseeker Swarm.name: Young Bloodseeker Swarm
Young Bloodseeker Swarm.publicNotes: Swarms of centipedes are dangerous indeed, ravenous carpets of skittering hunger capable of devouring a traveler whole in a matter of minutes. Some alchemists submerge whole centipedes taken from swarms in their elixirs and some mutagens, claiming such infusions increase potency, though other say this is nothing more than quackish claptrap. Kobolds and mitflits are both known to incorporate swarms of centipedes into cunning traps, from simple pits filled with vermin or more complex affairs involving chutes that dump the vermin onto the heads of unwary intruders.

action->Swarming Bites.name: Swarming Bites
action->Swarming Bites.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[1d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save) and @Damage[1[bleed]] damage. The young bloodseeker swarm gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. A creature that takes damage from the bloodseeker swarm is drained 1 until it receives healing (of any kind or amount).

action->Spine Rake.name: Spine Rake
action->Spine Rake.description: The young sea serpent extends the spines along its back and Swims or Strides. Each creature the serpent is adjacent to at any point during its movement takes @Damage[(1d4+2)[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:14|basic] save).

action->Young Sea Serpent Algae.name: Young Sea Serpent Algae
action->Young Sea Serpent Algae.description:
The water in the ballast organs around the sea serpent's neck is full of psychotropic algae.

Saving throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18|name:Young Sea Serpent Algae Poison]

Maximum duration 3 rounds

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} and, if flying, spends its first action each turn to descend 20 feet (1 round)

Zatqualmish (3-4).name: Zatqualmish (3-4)
Zatqualmish (3-4).allSavesBonus: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Illusions

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

weapon->Shortbow.name: Shortbow
weapon->Shortbow.description: This smaller bow is made of a single piece of wood and favored by skirmishers and cavalry.

equipment->Clothing (Fine).name: Clothing (Fine)
equipment->Clothing (Fine).description: Fine clothing, suitable for a noble or royal, is made with expensive fabrics, precious metals, and intricate patterns.

equipment->Writing Set.name: Writing Set
equipment->Writing Set.description: Using a writing set, you can draft correspondence and scribe scrolls. A set includes stationery, including a variety of paper and parchment, as well as ink, a quill or inkpen, sealing wax, and a simple seal. If you've written a large amount, you can refill your kit with extra ink and paper.

equipment->Writing Set (Extra Ink and Pa.name: Writing Set (Extra Ink and Paper)
equipment->Writing Set (Extra Ink and Pa.description: Extra ink and paper to refill your writing set.

equipment->Piccolo.name: Piccolo
equipment->Piccolo.description: Handheld instruments include bagpipes, a small set of chimes, small drums, fiddles and viols, flutes and recorders, small harps, lutes, trumpets, and similarly sized instruments. The GM might rule that an especially large handheld instrument (like a tuba) has greater Bulk. Heavy instruments such as large drums, a full set of chimes, and keyboard instruments are less portable and generally need to be stationary while played.

equipment->Thieves' Tools.name: Thieves' Tools
equipment->Thieves' Tools.description:
You need thieves' tools to Pick Locks or Disable Devices (of some types) using the Thievery skill.

If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Sw7MBLASN3xK4Y44]{Replacement Picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action.

consumable->Healing Potion (Minor).name: Healing Potion (Minor)
consumable->Healing Potion (Minor).description: A healing potion is a vial of a ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker's wounds heal rapidly. When you drink a healing potion, you regain @Damage[1d8[healing]] Hit Points.

consumable->Arrows.name: Arrows
consumable->Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Illus.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Illusions

action->Run Away!.name: Run Away!
action->Run Away!.description:
Trigger A creature ends its movement adjacent to Zatqualmish

Effect Zatqualmish Strides up to 10 feet (or his Speed, if that Speed is less than 10 feet). He must end his movement in a location that isn't within 5 feet of a foe.

This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Zatqualmish (5-6).name: Zatqualmish (5-6)
Zatqualmish (5-6).allSavesBonus: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Illusions

weapon->Shortbow.name: Shortbow
weapon->Shortbow.description: This smaller bow is made of a single piece of wood and favored by skirmishers and cavalry.

weapon->Rapier.name: Rapier
weapon->Rapier.description: The rapier is a long and thin piercing blade with a basket hilt. It is prized among many as a dueling weapon.

equipment->Clothing (Fine).name: Clothing (Fine)
equipment->Clothing (Fine).description: Fine clothing, suitable for a noble or royal, is made with expensive fabrics, precious metals, and intricate patterns.

equipment->Writing Set.name: Writing Set
equipment->Writing Set.description: Using a writing set, you can draft correspondence and scribe scrolls. A set includes stationery, including a variety of paper and parchment, as well as ink, a quill or inkpen, sealing wax, and a simple seal. If you've written a large amount, you can refill your kit with extra ink and paper.

equipment->Writing Set (Extra Ink and Pa.name: Writing Set (Extra Ink and Paper)
equipment->Writing Set (Extra Ink and Pa.description: Extra ink and paper to refill your writing set.

equipment->Piccolo.name: Piccolo
equipment->Piccolo.description: Handheld instruments include bagpipes, a small set of chimes, small drums, fiddles and viols, flutes and recorders, small harps, lutes, trumpets, and similarly sized instruments. The GM might rule that an especially large handheld instrument (like a tuba) has greater Bulk. Heavy instruments such as large drums, a full set of chimes, and keyboard instruments are less portable and generally need to be stationary while played.

equipment->Thieves' Tools.name: Thieves' Tools
equipment->Thieves' Tools.description:
You need thieves' tools to Pick Locks or Disable Devices (of some types) using the Thievery skill.

If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Sw7MBLASN3xK4Y44]{Replacement Picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action.

consumable->Healing Potion (Minor).name: Healing Potion (Minor)
consumable->Healing Potion (Minor).description: A healing potion is a vial of a ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker's wounds heal rapidly. When you drink a healing potion, you regain @Damage[1d8[healing]] Hit Points.

consumable->Arrows.name: Arrows
consumable->Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Illus.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Illusions

action->Run Away!.name: Run Away!
action->Run Away!.description:
Trigger A creature ends its movement adjacent to Zatqualmish

Effect Zatqualmish Strides up to 10 feet (or his Speed, if that Speed is less than 10 feet). He must end his movement in a location that isn't within 5 feet of a foe.

This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Zombie Brute (PFS 1-18).name: Zombie Brute (PFS 1-18)
Zombie Brute (PFS 1-18).publicNotes:
Necromantic augmentations have granted this zombie increased size and power.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

condition->Slowed.name: Slowed
condition->Slowed.description: You have fewer actions. Slowed always includes a value. When you regain your actions at the start of your turn, reduce the number of actions you regain by your slowed value. Because slowed has its effect at the start of your turn, you don't immediately lose actions if you become slowed during your turn.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Rotting Aura.name: Rotting Aura
action->Rotting Aura.description:
10 feet. The zombie emits an aura of rot and disease that causes wounds to fester and turn sour.

Any living creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the zombie and is not at full Hit Points takes @Damage[1d6[untyped]] damage as its wounds fester. Creatures that take a critical hit from the zombie also take this damage immediately.

strike-melee->Jaws.name: Jaws
strike-melee->Jaws.description: Requirements The zombie has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}.

action->Rotting Aura.name: Rotting Aura
action->Rotting Aura.description:

Any living creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the zombie and is not at full Hit Points takes @Damage[1d6[untyped]] damage as its wounds fester.

condition->Slowed.description: You have fewer actions. Slowed always includes a value. When you regain your actions at the start of your turn, reduce the number of actions you regain by your slowed value. Because slowed has its effect at the start of your turn, you don't immediately lose actions if you become slowed during your turn.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Corpse Throwing.name: Corpse Throwing
action->Corpse Throwing.description: A zombie minihulk can throw corpses at foes. While any Medium dead body will do, they sometimes throw zombie shamblers, who take just as much damage from being thrown as the target they hit. A thrown shambler lands prone, but if it's not destroyed, it can rise and use other actions normally.

action->Wide Swing.name: Wide Swing
action->Wide Swing.description: The zombie minihulk makes a hunk of meat melee Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within the Strike's reach. This attack counts as two attacks for the zombie minihulk's multiple attack penalty.

condition->Slowed.name: Slowed
condition->Slowed.description: You have fewer actions. Slowed always includes a value. When you regain your actions at the start of your turn, reduce the number of actions you regain by your slowed value. Because slowed has its effect at the start of your turn, you don't immediately lose actions if you become slowed during your turn.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Rotting Aura.name: Rotting Aura
action->Rotting Aura.description:
10 feet. The zombie riding horse emits an aura of rot and disease that causes wounds to fester and turn sour.

Any living creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the zombie and is not at full Hit Points takes @Damage[1d6[untyped]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:14|basic] save) as its wounds fester.

action->Feast.name: Feast
action->Feast.description: The zombie riding horse Strikes with its jaws against an adjacent living creature or a creature that has died in the past hour. On a success, the zombie riding horse can feast upon the creature's flesh to heal itself. This restores @Damage[1d6[healing]] Hit Points.

action->Gallop.name: Gallop
action->Gallop.description: The zombie riding horse Strides twice. It has a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed during these Strides

Zombie Shambler (PFS 1-03).name: Zombie Shambler (PFS 1-03)
Zombie Shambler (PFS 1-03).publicNotes:
A zombie shambler is a slow-moving horror dangerous in larger groups.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.
